ECProperty.description: a thickness which is the thickness of the part of an object normally called wall: - wall thickness of a pipe, - thickness of a building wall, etc.

ECClass.description: a physical object that is intended to permit, obstruct, regulate or divert fluid flow.
a fluid regulator that can be used to control (i.e. permit, obstruct, regulate or divert) a fluid stream.
a valve that includes an external means of operation. (e.g. handwheel / lever / actuator.)
an operated valve where the operator is an actuator.
an artefact intended to convert energy (electric, pneumatic, hydraulic) from an external source to kinetic energy in response to a signal..
Support Components
Support for elbow component
Adjustable Elbow Support
A support intended to support one or more pipes
Pipe Base Support
Adjustable Post Support
Adjustable Base Support
base class for all HVAC components. not in rdl.

ECProperty.description: A device which is a non-conductor or low-conductor capable of separate conducting bodies to prevent transfer of electricity, heat, or sound.

ECClass.description: A gas distributor intended to disperse air in a fluid
Hvac Equipments
A filter intended to remove particles from air
Value Map
Air filter types
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air.
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air.
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air.
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air.
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air.
an artefact which detects an aspect of a material; records, modifies and or displays such an aspect or performs a combination of these activities.
an instrument which records the value(s) represented by its input signal(s)
a valve that has valve ports which are not in-line.

a check valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.

a valve that can be used to modify (regulate) the fluid flow rate in a process control system. it usually includes an actuator, which responds to a signal from the controlling system and changes the position of the flow controlling element in the valve.

a control valve that is an angle valve with a corresponding actuator intended to manipulate a stream of fluid in response to a difference between a signal from an external sensing element and a setpoint and with input of energy from an external source.

a globe valve that deviates from the in-line design, i.e. with a body shape designed to adjust the flow direction with a specified angle relative to the straight through-flow an in-line valve would have provided for.
A pipe support intended to prevent movement of a pipe in one or more directions
Angle Guide
a mechanical separator which is separating solid particles from a fluid by passing the fluid through a wire mesh, screen or metal plates containing perforations or slits.
Pipe Anchor
Angled UBolt

ECRelationshipClass.description: A <containment_of_individual> is a <relative_location> where the located <possible_individual> is contained by the locator <possible_individual> but is not part of it.

A <composition_of_individual> is a <relationship> that indicates that the part <possible_individual> is a part of the whole <possible_individual>. A simple composition is indicated, unless a subtype is instantiated too.
An <arrangement_of_individual> is a <composition_of_individual> that indicates that the part is a part of an <arranged_individual>. The temporal extent of the part is that of the whole.

An <assembly_of_individual> is an <arrangement_of_individual> that indicates that the part is connected directly or indirectly to other parts of the whole. The parts and wholes are super-molecular objects.

ECClass.displayLabel: Associated item list for Hvac Components
Associated Item List for Piping Component
Associated item list for Tray Components

ECClass.description: Axial nozzle that is shaped like an elbow
base class for all equipments. not in rdl.
An equipment class that contains classes that are classified as rotating equipment
An artefact which delivers or exhausts volumes of air or gas at low differential pressure.
A fan where the flow is along axis of shaft and the pressure ratio is relatively low. Typically single stage with both axial inlet and outlet.
a fluid regulator that permits fluid to flow in one direction only.
a valve that permits fluid to flow in one direction only.
a check valve that is a check valve in which the closure member is lifted from the seat during forward flow. e.g. ball, piston, nozzle check, and foot valves.
a lift check valve that is having a free spring loaded ball closing on a spherical seat.
a rotary valve that has a ball closure member.
A physical object that is an external means of operating a valve.
A valve operating device that is intended to be driven by human power.
Bar Handle
a device which contains instruments, controlling and signalling devices arranged in a suitable manner.
Base support for pipe
a strainer where the screen has the shape of a basket.
A physical object that is a convoluted or corrugated section, intended to absorb some movement, axial and/or perpendicular to the bellow's transverse axis.

ECProperty.description: No. of arches in the bellows

ECClass.description: an artefact where one of the ends, namely the flanged end, has the shape of a circular plate with holes to make a bolted connection.
a piping flange without a central opening intended for the shut off of a flanged end.
A coupling provided between two bolts
an artefact consisting of two halves shaped to be placed over a piping hub end and connected. intended to connect pipes and/or piping components.
a pipe clamp which is connected by bolts.
a butterfly valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.
a rotary valve that has a closure member of a disc type with a shaft parallel, or near parallel, to the plane of the disc, with an axis of rotation transverse to the flow direction.
an artefact which is an assembly comprising of a conductor with its own insulation (and screens if any)
an artefact intended to receive cables which are usually arranged to run side by side.
An 'artefact' that is intended to join pipes, hoses and/or piping components. At least one of the ends have to be female coupler end or male adapter end.
an artefact which is an assembly of terminals mounted on a rail.
a device in which energy is added or removed, constantly or periodically, to a fluid.
a dynamic pump utilizing impellers provided with vanes generating centrifugal force to achieve the equired pressure head.
A mechanical connector which is used to make up a joint in a pipeline, flowline or hub using a pipe clamp.
A mechanical connector which is used to make up a joint in a pipeline, flowline or hub using a bolted pipe clamp.
an artefact with different nominal pipe size at the two ends, intended to connect pipes or piping components.
a piping reducer where the center lines of the two ends are in line.
a piping reducer which is a nipple of specific short length, and of relatively small nominal size.
a concentric swaged piping nipple.

a valve that is a valve where the opening of the closure member is big enough to allow a sphere equal to the valve's nominal size to pass through the closure member. (bore approximately equivalent to the pipe bore.)

a valve with a circular hole in the closure member that will pass a sphere no smaller than specified for the applicable nominal size (less the tolerance), except that the end preparation of weld-end valves may require a smaller bore at the weld end to properly mate with the pipe.
a conduit valve of the gate valve type.
Cone Operator
A strainer where the screen has a conical tubular shape.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A <connection_of_individual> is a <relationship> that indicates that matter, energy, or both can be transferred between the members of <possible_individual> that are connected, either directly or indirectly.

ECClass.description: a panel containing full set of indicating devices and remote control units required for operation of a system or part of it.
a part of a component which provides a re-usable connection.
a physical object that is intended to transfer heat from one object to another.
Cube Operator
A device for suppressing unfavourable characteristics or behavior.
a control valve that is intended to operate at high temperature, and admit water into a deluge system. it is fail safe, kept closed by pressurised gas, and is typically made of bronze.
Design area represents a specific portion of the project for a given discipline (PDS specifics)

ECProperty.description: Discipline of the area: Piping, Equipment, etc

ECClass.description: a physical object that is capable of detecting a state or a change in state, e.g. pressure or temperature, or detect the precence of a selected substance.

ECRelationshipClass.description: A <feature_whole_part> is an <arrangement_of_individual> that indicates that the part is a non-separable, contiguous part of the whole.
A <direct_connection> is a <connection_of_individual> that indicates that the side_1 and side_2 are directly connected via a common spatial boundary.

ECClass.description: an actuator which is pneumatically operated and uses low-pressure air supply
Diaphragm Gear Operator
Diaphragm Operator
a valve that is a valve where the closure member is a flexible membrane.
a membrane valve that is a membrane valve where the closure member is a resilient diaphragm being forced against a port.
an artefact intended to display the value or the status of a condition
an indicator intended to give a visual indication of the pressure in a pre defined process segment.
a pressure indicator which is indicating the difference between two fluid pressures applied to it.

Directional Pipe Guide Boxes
Directional Support Anchor Boxes
Directional Support Guide Boxes
A file based Document

ECRelationshipClass.description: An <other_relationship> is a <relationship> that is not a member of any of the other explicit subtypes of <relationship>

ECClass.description: a device which is a line of pipe, possibly also including pumps, valves, and control devices, intended for conveying liquids, gases, or finely divided solids. pipelines starts and ends with objects connecting the line to another unit, including another pipline.
a set of interconnected cable-tray components.
Miscellaneous supports
Double Pipe Trunnion support
a valve that can be used to drain empty a piping system, storage tank, or similar. the drain valve is typically installed at the lowest point of the system to allow draining by gravity.
an artefact which is a one-piece cylindrical section intended to join pipes and/or piping components.
a piping coupling intended to connect pipes and/or piping components with varying lengths of engagement

ECProperty.description: The distance between the two pipes that are being coupled

ECClass.description: Base Drip Leg
an artefact which is a discrete component intended to make a change in the direction of a pipe run between 0 and 135 degrees.
a device that is intended to set in motion, set going, supply motive power for a mill, machinery, etc.
a recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.

Dummy Leg Support

a piping reducer where the centerlines of the two ends have an offset.
a valve that is a valve where the closure member has a rotating action. the axis of rotation is usually normal to the flow.
a rotary valve that has a quarter turn action in which the closure member is a cylindrical or tapered plug which operates by rotating on its axis and sealing against a downstream seat.
an eccentic swaged piping nipple.
an artefact which is self reinforced and intended to be welded onto a hole in the wall of a pipe or a piping component and the other end to be connected to another pipe or piping component.
an olet making a reducing tangent branch on a piping elbow.
an actuator intended to convert an electric signal into a signal of any kind, such as mechanical displacement
an electromagnetic coil which is a cylindrical coil, whose length is usually much greater than its transverse dimensions.
an actuator that is used to change and/or maintain the position of the closing member of a valve.
A valve actuator that is intended to be driven by an electric motor.
base class for all piping branches. not in rdl.
an artefact with 4 ends/branches mutually at right angles in one plane
a piping cross where all four ends have the same nominal size.
an artefact with three piping ends where the branch is angled to the run, typically at 45 degrees.
A pipe lateral where the ends have the same nominal size.
an artefact with 3 piping ends in t-shape, including a branch at 90 degrees
a piping tee where all 3 ends have the same nominal pipe size.
a piping tee where all ends are threaded ends.
a pipe tee with externally and internally threaded ends.

a detector intended to sense a flame. typically in a furnace or a fire area

a check valve that is a check valve where the closure member is a disc which swings freely on a hinge and which opens automatically when flow is established and closes automatically when flow ceases or is reversed.
a swing check valve that is equipped with a hinged disc or flap, sometimes leather or rubber faced, intended for low pressure applications.

a flexible piping coupling intended to connect pipes and/or piping to accomadate any angular, axial and radial deformation on joint
an artefact which is a long tube or hollow body intended for conducting liquid, gaseous or finely divided solid material or for structural purposes.

a control valve that is a self operating valve with a built in actuator (without input of signal or energy from external sources).
a self acting control valve that usually is operated by a float mechanism to regulate or maintain a liquid level in a tank.
a device located in a flowstream measuring the flow.
an instrument intended to measure and indicate directly the measured value without auxiliary energi supply

ECClass.description: a gauge intended to indicate flow
an indicator intended to give a visual indication of mass or volume per time unit of a fluid passing through an open or closed conduit.
a detecting instrument intended to measure and indicate flow rate and/or produce a signal which represents the measured flow rate.
a device which is intended to provide a certain distance between two parts within an assembly.
an orifice plate which restrict the flow and thus develops the differential pressure that is proportional to the square of the flow rate.
a device that maintains a desired quantity at a predetermined level, usually by comparison with a reference source.
a regulator which uses normaly the differential pressure principle over an orifice to control the valvetrim
an artefact which is transparent and intended for inspection.
a sight glass mounted on a pipe to see inside for flow inspection.

a mechanical switching device intended to make, carry and break currents under normal circuit conditions which may include specified operating overload conditions and also carrying for a specified time currents under specified abnormal circuit conditions
a switch intended to give a signal when the flow have reached a preset value
an electronic circuit that receives a process variable signal and converts it into a standardised output signal.
a transmitter which output is relative to a measured flow rate

a valve that has multiple paths of flow through itself.
a multi way valve that is made with four separate paths of flow.

a device intended to reduce or prevent the passage of fluid between artefacts, which may or may not be moving relative to each other. typically used in order to prevent loss, hazard, damage or contamination .

a valve that is a valve where the closure member is a disc or piston operating with linear motion normal to the flat or shaped seat.
a piping coupling where only one of the ends have been shaped to allow linear connection. the other end has a drilled hole.

ECClass.description: an input/output card with electronic components intended to receive and encode one or more signals to a computer interpretable format
a piping reducer with one plain end, one larger socket welding end.
a valve that is intended to enable or prevent a fluid condition to be in direct conact with a fluid stream .

a device which is, or is intended to be installed inside another device
Indicates two ports are connected
a gate valve that has a narrow parallel gate with a shaped edge indented to cut through glutenous media or slurries when closing.
a piping flange intended to be used with stub ends. it differs from a lapped flange by not having a recess in the faced end so that the stub end protrude past the face of the flange.
A physical object that is made to connect a pipe or piping component to a lapped flange.
an olet making a reducing branch connection at an angle less than 90 (typically 45) degrees on a straight pipe.
a gauge intended to display a representation of a measured level
a regulator which uses a float to control the valvetrim
a switch intended to give a on/off signal when liquid level have reached a preset value
a transmitter measuring the level and generating a standardized output signal.

a piping elbow where the centerline radius is 1.5 times the nominal size, except for small sizes (nps<1") which have larger radii. for reducing elbows the radius is 1.5 times the nominal pipe size of the large end.
equipment manway using nozzle implementation
This class indicates the type of material
A gasket type used in mechnical joint connections
A physical object that is intended to position an item. Typically applied to compress packing rings in a stuffing box.
A gasket that is made from metal alloy, or which contains substance of metal alloys.

an instrument intended to measure a physical quantity (iev, iec-770-1) and to indicate and/or to transmit a signal which represents a measured variable. it typically consists of items which have a role as a primary element and a secondary element respectivily.
an artefact intended to change piping direction with a non-standard radius, fabricated from mitred pipe segments.

a device for employing the energy of some natural agent or force for the impulsion of machinery; a machine that supplies the motive power for the propulsion of a vehicle or vessel. in recent use also in a narrower sense excluding steam engines.
control valve with electric motor actuator
A valve actuator that is driven by an electrical motor.
a valve that is assigned to handle muddy substances.

a globe valve that has a closure member with the shape of a conical plug (needle) which closes into a small seat. typically used for flow metering or damping of pressure fluctuations on instruments, e.g. pressure gauge.
an olet making a 90-degree branch and which has an integral pipe nipple.
straight axial nozzle on equipment
equipment lugs using nozzle implementation
straight radial nozzle on equipment
radial manway nozzle
a seal which is a ring made of rubber, elastomer or other special material.
a seal ring with a circular cross section.
a pipe flange that is provided with taps for instrument connection.
a plate with a specified hole which creates a pressure drop in a fluid flowing through a closed conduit.
an input/output card intended to decode and transmit one or more electrical signals from a computer interpretable format to an output signal
Mechanical air terminal device which delivers conditioned air to a space.
Oval shape connection supply diffuser.
Process and Instrumentation Diagram
a full bore valve suitable for the passage of pigs and spheres.
a membrane valve that is comprising a flexible tube, either exposed or enclosed in a body. the tube is pinched to close by mechanical means.

an artefact with one external threaded end and one smaller internal threaded end intended to accommodate different bore diameters.
an artefact which is intended to provide closure at a piping end by fitting on or over the end, as opposed to inside.
a piping cross where the nominal sizes of the ends are not the same.
a reducing piping cross where the nominal sizes of two opposite branches are different and smaller than the other opposite pair, which have the same nominal size.

a piping tee where the nominal diameters of the ends are not all the same.
a reducing piping tee where the branch has a smaller nominal size than both the header (run) ends, which have the same nominal size.
a reducing piping tee where one of the header (run) ends and the branch has a smaller nominal size than that of the other header (run).

ECClass.description: an artefact which is an assembly of three items comprising of two threaded ends and a center piece that draws the two ends together when rotated. this avoids the need to turn the connected pipe components
A physical object that has 3 pipe ends in Y-shape, where the branches diverge in the same plane and at 45 degrees to the main axis.

ECClass.description: A device which consists of the land, buildings, machinery, apparatus, and fixtures employed in carrying on a trade or an industrial business.
An area which is a subdivision of a plant by functional areas.
Platform Pipe Guides
An actuator that is intended to be operated by pneumatic power.
A pneumatic actuator that is designed to operate a valve.
a gauge intended to measure and display a representation of a measured pressure
a self acting control valve that is maintaining a predefined upstream or downstream fluid flow operated by the process pressure.

a self actuated pressure control valve that is equipped with an internal pressure sensing element that reduces the upstream line pressure to a set level downstream, and maintains the reduced pressure irrespective of changes in upstream pressure.
a regulator that is regulating the pressure in system.
a valve that includes a means of operation (e.g. spring / gravity / fluid pressure / counter balance), and is not depending on an external source of energy.
a self operating valve that is set to open at a certain pressure level to prevent the pressure in a container or system from reaching unsafe levels.
a relief valve that is an automatic pressure relieving device actuated by the static pressure upstream of the valve.
a switch which is turned on and off by the variation of a pressure level.
a transmitter mesuring pressure and generating a standardized output signal representing the measured pressure
a controller intended to contain and execute control logic software

A pressure vessel located in both pump- and compressor piping systems in order to reduce residual pulsation fluctuations, as a result of discontinue operation effects, within an allowable level specified.

a piping flange where the non-flanged end is a slip on end.

a piping flange where the non-flanged end is a threaded end.

a piping flange where the non-flanged end is a hub or neck with a butt welding end.

a piping bend which is specially manufactured, e.g. with a non standard radius or angle.

an artefact consisting of two disc with equal thickness and outer diameter connected with a flat bar. one of the discs is furnished with a hole thus allowing fluid flow, and the other blocing the flow. the first is installed during normal operation, the latter when blocking is required.

a functional device which is a short section of pipe used to connect ends of pipes/pipelines.

A humidifier that increases the humidity in air by adding water as steam into the air.
A trap that consists of a chamber into which condensed steam from steam pipes etc. is allowed to drain, and which automatically ejects it withoutpermitting the escape of steam
a lift check valve that is combining the self-acting operation of a check valve with the manual action of a globe valve.
cylindrical threaded fastener (with external thread) without a head or driving recess that is generally threaded from both ends and is plain in the middle.
Support Location
an olet which makes a 90-degree reducing branch with a swept profile at the connection to the main run pipe.
A functional object which is an assembly of functional units forming a network to provide a type of service or serving a common purpose. The functional units does not have to be physically connected.
A wrench that is intended for manual operation of a valve.
A handle extending on both sides of the stem/shaft centre line.

a fluid regulator that controls the flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container. taps are often attached to a sink or bath.

an indicator intended to give a visual indication of a temperature.
a regulator intnded to control a temperature using the expansion of a substance
a switch that is intended to give a on/off signal when the temperature have reached a preset value.
a transmitter measuring and generating a standardized output signal representing the measured temperature
a pressure-tight receptacle adapted to receive a temperature sensing element, provided with external threads or other means for pressure-tight attachment to a vessel or pipe.
an olet making a 90 degree branch with a threaded connection at the branch end.
a multi way valve that is made with three separate paths of flow.
a ball valve that is a three way valve with three paths of flow through the valve body.
a plug valve that is a three way valve with three paths of flow through the valve body.
a structure or building that is lofty in proportion to the size of its base, either isolated or forming part of another construction.
a multi way valve that is made with two separate paths of flow.

a ball valve that has a v-shaped port in the ball.
a seal ring with a v-shaped cross section.

a valve that can be used for ventilation purposes.
